website_summaries.verdict: For budget-minded consumers who want top-notch features in an umbrella, this is the best value available.
pros: Offers similar features and durability as umbrellas that are more expensive
cons: Some consumers report it is a little difficult to close

website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you need a storm umbrella that's fairly portable, though it comes with some quality and longevity concerns.
pros: Lightweight, compact design folds to less than 12", making it ideal for travel
Does a good job repelling rain, thanks to the Teflon coating
Handle is sturdy and easy to grip
Backed by a lifetime replacement guarantee
cons: Rivets have been reported to rust from repeated exposure to moisture
Opening mechanism tends to stick with frequent use

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this umbrella after my previous cheap umbrella cut my finger while opening it. I loved that this umbrella has a lifetime replacement warranty. That factored heavily into my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F. Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: I do like the fact that it opens when you push the ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use this yet but I'm traveling to Florida and the weather is calling for rain all week. I do like the fact that it opens when you push the button, but it also closes when you push it. All you have to do is push the handle back in!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality in good condition
customer_reviews.text: The product fully corresponds to the description. Excellent quality in good condition. Very comfortable and pleasant to touch handle. I recommend everyone this seller and his product - No. 1 in this category from Amazon (as of July 17, 2017) In my photo you can see the quality of the handle and the design of the spokes at the umbrella
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Osadchiy

customer_reviews.title: Great little compact umbrella for every day commuting
customer_reviews.text: Old umbrella gave up the ghost and decided to purchase this brand based on Amazon reviews. Pros: Lightweight, opens smoothly, auto fold up button, smooth textured grip. Umbrella repels water admirably and seems to dry much quicker than standard umbrellas. Good price on Amazon. Cons: None that I can report at this time. Bottom Line: If you are in need of a small, lightweight umbrella for daily commuting to and from work, I highly recommend this umbrella. It repels water and drys quickly, which is a great benefit when walking into the office on a soggy morning.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Water did not soak into the fabric. A few shakes and it was nearly dry. Also the spring loaded folding feature was very very cool and useful. Though, it is better if you lower the umbrella first, as the umbrella folds so quickly and with such force that it leaves a cloud of water droplets where the umbrella once was, that will then fall on whomever is standing underneath. I liked the diameter, even in a bit of a breeze I was able to keep my knees and higher dry and I'm nearly six feet tall.
customer_reviews.author: draco_cj

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella and fast drying
customer_reviews.text: This is the best umbrella I have ever purchased or used. As soon as I get home or get to the office, I shut the umbrella and brush the excess water and wow. There is almost no water on the umbrella. It is also fast drying and very sturdy. I tried it on a windy day too, recently and it held very well. Amazing product and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Nadir Durrani

customer_reviews.title: My favorite umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this umbrella. It folds nice and small so it's great for travel or even just a night out. Opens to a reasonable size and is very durable. Also nice that it opens and closes automatically. When getting out of the car in the rain I just stick it out the door opening and pop the button. No need to get out in the rain then open. Just reverse the process getting in. Highly recommend this umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Umbrealla
customer_reviews.text: I've had no issues with the umbrella and feel like it'll get the job done for good while. I love that the button both releases and pulls back in the umbrella which makes getting into the car exponentially easier. Solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Love the one click open, one click close feature.
customer_reviews.author: enem156

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, yet compact.
customer_reviews.text: It’s very compact, fits in the side pocket of my bookbag, and the spring works very well, while being durable in windy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolas Denicola

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Travel Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I just received this umbrella in time for a spring (rainy??) trip to London. I am quite impressed with the construction. It feels much sturdier than my Victorinox (The Victorinox has only six ribs and leaked like a sieve). The Repel umbrella opens and closes very smoothly, and when it opens you have the feeling that the springs are stout. Nothing wimpy about this umbrella. The size is perfect for travel and the weight reasonable for a quality product. Coming with a lifetime warranty is a real plus. I will post an update if this does not perform to my expectations ... but I have every reason to believe it will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... all of the reviews and everyone seem to be happy but I am in New York City right now ...
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the reviews and everyone appears to be happy woth this thing but I am in New York City right now and it is raining. I used it for 45 minutes, closed it and then opened it up again five minutes later and it wouldn’t stay open. A string was sticking out from the top and it no longer works. Very very disappointed. It worked well for 45 minutes so if you only need an umbrella for 45 minutes, this is the one to buy. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Gabe Sachs

customer_reviews.title: Seems Like It's a Well Made Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I just received my umbrella. Looks to be well made. I have not had a chance to use it yet as weather has been great! Only time will tell how well it functions and stands up to the elements. For now, I will have to defer to those who have reviewed it and owned it for several months and have had good experience with it. The company that makes it has been quite communicative having sent me two emails reminding me of the lifetime warranty. Nice to see them being proactive!! Other companies/manufacturers could learn something from them. Reach out and touch your customers! Seems like they stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: EandOH

customer_reviews.title: STOP HERE!! You have found your next umbrella!!
customer_reviews.text: These are really cool, awesome customer service. I got a pink one for my mom, and a black one for myself.. They pop open, and with the same push of the button the retract and close.. Pretty cool. Kinda stiff to collapse after that, but not in a bad way. Once you use it you will understand what I mean.. All in all its a great product, would buy again 100%
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Virtually Indestructible?????
customer_reviews.text: In theory, it should resist to strong winds, storms, tornadoes... But actually it got broken on 3rd use, simply opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo G

customer_reviews.title: Two-thumbs Down!
customer_reviews.text: Just moved to Chicago. Bought this umbrella and used it for the very first time. One strong wind gust and not only did it turn inside out, but it broke. Two-thumbs down and I'm wet!
customer_reviews.author: Mtietz-Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Best umbrella I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best umbrella I've ever had. I bought it after looking online for one that wouldn't fall apart at the first gust of wind in a rainstorm. After using several times in a huge rainstorm with heavy winds, it seems to be indestructible. The strong wind will flip the umbrella inside out, but it quickly flips back and show no sign of being worse for wear. I plan to buy several more so I can be sure to have one at my home, office and car.
customer_reviews.author: Chris 9292

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even make it through one season in Chicago
customer_reviews.text: Product is far more flimsy than anticipated and does not stand up to normal Chicago wind. Within one season of 20min walking commutes, it stopped locking open.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Rain leaked from a hole
customer_reviews.text: Bought this umbrella for a trip to Italy. But it had a hole and leaked from the top while it was raining :/ it got my hair wet and made it frizzy. Would been better off with a $6 umbrella being sold on the street. Everything else was fine about the umbrella, but it didn’t do the one things it’s actually supposed to do
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Got it because I was traveling to Washington state. I didn’t take it with me because it broke right after I took it out the box. I hit the release button and and one of the support bars broke.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Uodated.  broke 2nd time it was used
customer_reviews.text: plastic hinges broke second time used. have not been able to get a replacement. some lifetime warranty The company has made good on the warranty, I now have a new one, stay tuned for update.
customer_reviews.author: gerard

customer_reviews.title: when it was in a good condition. However
customer_reviews.text: It got the job done, when it was in a good condition. However, after only use this umbrella for few times, the head piece breaks. For the price, I'm not expecting this kind of quality update: They manged to sent me a new one
customer_reviews.author: RENY

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: These are great little umbrellas. They perform well and I've used them for both rain and sun. Actually, I sat at a soccer game with two of them propped up behind my head holding off a fierce and beastly storm and they held tough. Although the rain was coming in sideways and the wind was blowing something treacherous, they were like a little protective shield for me. The picture is what the storm looked like from my view, you can see the other guys umbrella buckling from facing the terror this Mid-Western deluge. I would recommend after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: S.W.J. Bower

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far
customer_reviews.text: I'm really like it so far. It will be interesting to see how long the open/close button works. With the way this is built I think it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dale James

customer_reviews.title: Great One-Person Folding Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Great umbrella for one. It fits in the slot in the car door. It opens easily. It closes easily. Comes in a variety of colors. We bought four so we can keep two in each car. If you need to share one umbrella with a partner, this is small for that.
customer_reviews.author: Abracadbra

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sturdy Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Needed a compact umbrella for work and traveling. Have used it once on a windy rainy day, and it held up. Follow the instructions to close it, and it will work well. I tried to force it at first, but once I reread the instructions, I was able to close it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer0314

customer_reviews.title: For travel
customer_reviews.text: I am going to use this for travel and it seems to be the right size to carry
customer_reviews.author: Gloria A. Sebasky

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this umbrella is a bargain. Sturdy and strong. it's a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: So far no problem, everything works. I will know later after continuous use how to rate it.
customer_reviews.author: Buster

customer_reviews.title: NOT windproof but nice umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Its a quality umbrella and I do like the automatic open and close button feature, but it is definitely not windproof like advetised knocking it down 1 star for me. I live in NYC and used the umbrella on an April rainy day, 1 gust of wind flipped this umbrella inside out. While it is a nice quality umbrella with a nice feel to it, it is no way windproof like they say. I would still recommend it because no one likes to get caught out there on a rainy day and it is compact size
customer_reviews.author: Herman L.

customer_reviews.title: I've only used it like 6 times
customer_reviews.text: I bought this umbrella because it was highly rated about a month ago. I've only used it like 6 times. Pretty much the first time I started using it, the umbrella sleeve stitching started coming loose. Only a matter of time before it's no longer useful. Just today the end cap of the umbrella came off. So, I'd have to say, skip this model. At this rate it's won't work in a few more months.
customer_reviews.author: Tim R

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: I plunked down my money on this "wind proof" umbrella because a trusted review site recommended it. The wind has its way with this umbrella left and right, all too often turning it out. Annoying as that is (and for a wind proof umbrella it's quite annoying) it finally (on a recent bout of 10-mile-an-hour wind) started to come undone. Had it two months and i'm well outside my return window. Still has life left in it, but since its begun its downward slope, methinks entropy will quicken. Such disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: chaos dollheads

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for a While.
customer_reviews.text: Worked Great for a While. Then it started sticking either open or closed. It's pretty hard to operate. It comes with a lifetime warranty so I contacted the Seller. The first time they promised to send a new one but never did. The second time they said they would send it right out but they never did. Promises, promises...
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Light weight = flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: I love how light weight this is, however I haven't noticed that it's any more water-repellant than any other umbrella that I've ever used. Where this really loses points, however, is that the very first time I used it, the wind blew the umbrella inside out and it immediately collapsed. Not even gale-force winds, just a quick, normal surge of wind. Seems like we've forfeited structural integrity in order to keep it light weight, but it's not worth it if the umbrella can't even make it 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: AZShopper

customer_reviews.title: Update: They made things right...
customer_reviews.text: Update: The company made things right with me. They did send a replacement umbrella fulfilling the lifetime warranty. It was important for me to let them know that the umbrella after only a few uses in 10 months had broken. I did send video in an email so they knew the product had really broken. They processed and sent a replacement right away. I do appreciate their efforts because my other automatic umbrella that I’ve had for at least 10 years that still works great is too big for travel. Thanks guys.... —
customer_reviews.author: Xultar

customer_reviews.title: "LIFETIME REPLACEMENT GUARANTEE" unless it breaks twice!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good umbrella for the price, I guess, unless....it breaks 3 times. They offer a "lifetime replacement" guarantee but apparently it's my fault this thing broke 3 times in 2 years. Even worse is I can't imagine I used all 3 of them combined more than a few dozen times during that time-frame. I offered to return my original broken one as proof that I'm not just asking for a free umbrella if they paid for return shipping and all they said was "sorry, no, here is a 10% promo."
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted a few really good umbrellas for the storms we've been getting....
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 different colors: black, the one one with the clear blue sky on the inside, yellow, and pink. A rib on the clear blue sky one broke on the 2nd use. The yellow one was always hard to collapse to begin with, and on the 3rd use, after putting up a little fight, something broke and no longer opens nor collapse. Hopefully the remaining 2 will last longer than these two.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: So sad, it bent in moderate wind : (
customer_reviews.text: I bought this once, and it wouldn't collapse. I gave a new one a shot and it bent on moderate wind in Nashville (it was not a storm, just a wind gust)
customer_reviews.author: R. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Came Broken
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time ordering from this vendor. First time the waterproofing came off within one week, the inside rusted, and the joint pins came out. My friend who also bought this umbrella had the pins fall out of the umbrella joints too. I was told that that was a manufacturing error and a bunch were recalled. This is time, the joint came broken and the umbrella won't close. I'm not sure if this is a quality control error or if I am just unlucky. I'd just like to hear what the vendor has to say.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent umbrella compromised by poor-quality rivets
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella appears to be robust; I used it recently during rain and gusty winds in New York with no problems. However, though the ribs seem largely rustproof, I am disappointed to see visible rusting at a couple of the rivets where sections of the ribs are joined, in one case offsetting to the fabric of the umbrella. It makes no sense to me to construct a good frame from rust-resistant materials only to sacrifice that quality with cheap rivets. I’m disappointed, though I’ll keep this.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ripley-Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Wow could not be more disappointed and annoyed. I bought this umbrella specifically for the reviews. Got it to take on a 5 week trip abroad. The first day I used it within minutes it was flipped inside out with a slightest breeze. It kept happening over and over and I’m looking around and no one else’s umbrella is doing this. I spent more time uncovered and flipping it back that I ended up throwing it away in the middle of a downpour in London and walking with just the hood of my jacket. Having this umbrella accomplished nothing but adding weight to my bag and taking up space.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Garroutte

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great missile!
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for a couple dozen usages, then the trigger button decided to make the umbrella a projectile, so powerful it shoots right out of my hands! In this new role, the canopy no longer remains open. Fear not, the "Repel" can now be used to repel home invasion.
customer_reviews.author: NDiego

customer_reviews.title: Not dogproof but otherwise seems pretty great
customer_reviews.text: I want to give this five stars. I should be able to give this five stars. But alas, I cannot. Because this umbrella is not dog proof. It did not withstand my scoundrel's curiosity long enough for me to test its strength and water repellancy. I did, however, confirm the very snazzy and slightly startling auto open/close feature. Which may have been what sealed its fate as a dog chew toy. I will reorder and hide from Fido.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine S

customer_reviews.title: Repel Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I have had this umbrella for a while now. If you have arthritis or are elderly, this is not the umbrella for you. Opening is so funny. Push the top button and zoom it is open in such a hurry that water goes everywhere if you're in a rain storm. Closing is so hard. Push the bottom button and it takes brute force to close it. Sometimes you hear the click, but it flies open again. You are soaking wet by this time and need a towel. No towel comes with the umbrella, but should.
customer_reviews.author: Cherokee Woman

customer_reviews.title: lifetime guarantee
customer_reviews.text: There is no lifetime guarantee - sending third request to replace my broken umbrella- they just ignoring me
customer_reviews.author: larissa

customer_reviews.title: Great product, good pricing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a trip to Shanghai during a rainy season. Needed to be windproof, rainproof, large enough to shield two and fit into a suitcase. This umbrella filled all the requirements and more. I noted that the 9 struts on the umbrella gave it extra support. When the lid did flip upward in a heavy wind, it was easy to rotate the umbrella and turn the top down in stages. The automatic open/close feature was nice, however in closing it was difficult to shorten the stem in order to load the spring and return the umbrella to the short length that you see in the photo. A weaker person would have difficulty or might eventually damage this umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: support
customer_reviews.text: I am a 67 year old banker, been banking for over 45 years. I have owned lots of umbrellas over those years. This is the worst umbrella I have ever used. I got it as a Christmas present and used it for the first (and only) time today. It broke on the first use. It is too late to be returned so I will throw it in the trash where it belongs Update the seller has agreed to refund the purchase price in the interest of customer support. That action is one of product confidence, unfortunately mine didn't work but many other reviewers were happy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Moser

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped....
customer_reviews.text: For all the money I paid for this umbrella, I'm incredibly disappointed that after TWO uses, the inner metal is rusting! I left it open, (not fully, since it would be in the way in my small home), but it took an eternity to dry out and when it finally had, I noticed the rust! I expected a much better quality at the cost I paid. Also, the inside has plastic parts! I was purchasing this for it's "windproof" ability. I guess they meant a light breeze. In real weather, this isn't the go-to. Of course, I bought it in preparation of the bad weather, and am past my return period. Oh well. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Krysrox413

customer_reviews.title: Good until it rusts, gets replaced and then the second one rusts. End of lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light Did not break in the wind Cons: Rusted after less than a dozen uses in a year The free replacement rusted within 6 months and umbrella actually felt wet to the touch from the inside Seller says only 1 replacement but I can have a code for 10% off... The code is 10OFFUEP for those who want to try for themselves, I will shop elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: SMN SMWR

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these umbrellas. I waited till we had a good soaking rain so I could fairly review my purchase. I opened up one of the umbrellas this morning. It opened up immediately and I thought, wow this is really good. It was light yet really kept me dry and protected from the wind. I was VERY pleased with the umbrella UNTIL it came time to close it. The button would not function to close the umbrella. I had to force it shut manually which was not easy. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ltbigfan

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, however, it’s way too small for a man. It may have been made with a special material to bounce off the rain, but when it’s so small, unfortunately, the rain seems to find you anyway. At $20, it’s also quite expensive compared to similar umbrellas (which only cost $6-$8). I’ve decided to keep it since paying $6 for return delivery wasn’t worth it. I will probably purchase a golf umbrella even though it doesn’t fold. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CbIHO4EK

customer_reviews.title: sOMETHING BROKE ON MINE
customer_reviews.text: SOMETHING BROKE ON MINE WHICH CAUSED IT TO OPEN VIOLENTLY. MY ELDERLY FATHER WENT TO USE IT AND IT HURT HIS WRIST. I TRIED IT BECAUSE OLD PEOPLE DO OLD PEOPLE THINGS AND THE DANG THING SHOT OUT THE BOTTOM OF MY HAND AND HIT MY RIGHT IN THE GUT. IT ACTUALLY HURT! FELT LIKE I GOT PUNCHED IN THE STOMACH. VERY UNHAPPY WITH THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: dmiami123

customer_reviews.title: I've had two umbrellas, each for about a month ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had two umbrellas, each for about a month. On both, the spring that opens and shuts the umbrella broke, so both now will not stay open.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I'd re-consider buying this.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get it to close!! I should've known it was a bad sign when I had to "re-launch" 2 times before getting it opened my very first time using it. First I had an issue with it extending powerfully but the umbrella wouldn't open. I had to re-do it a few times but it eventually worked. Few hours later, I couldn't shorten the length, despite being able to earlier in the day. I'm glad there's a lifetime guarantee but I don't want to have to call for a replacement every time I use it!
customer_reviews.author: sp4nky

customer_reviews.title: SUPERCALIFRAGILISTICALLY DESIGNED FOR YOUR PROTECTION!
customer_reviews.text: Marty Poppins (Mary's cousin) would be proud to own this heavy duty, rain repellent, truly automatic umbrella. It's sturdy design makes it virtually windproof as well, for those long trips above the skyline while traveling to the next nanny assignment. You'll feel secure holding it above your head and when you land the children will be wide-eyed and supercalifragilistically impressed as you push a button and it collapses into a neat bundle, ready to be secured with its handy Velcro wrap and pushed back into its handle until the job is finished and you call upon its protection again.
customer_reviews.author: Imjusta Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Over-priced under-delivers.
customer_reviews.text: Rather than buying a cheap umbrella, I was swayed by the product reviews and thought this must be a great item since it cost three times the price of an umbrella its size. Well, it turns out it just cost three times as much. This is a classic example of a product that overpromises and under-delivers. There is nothing special here and it just costs more.
customer_reviews.author: That is correct.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed with the durability of this product
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, great reviews, and advertising associated with this umbrella, I truly expected a superior product capable of withstanding wind. After over a year of use in New England, I can confidently say that this umbrella will not hold up against strong winds. Your hand and wrist will ache from holding on to the flimsy frame and you will inevitably get turned inside-out repeatedly. I am fed up with this unreliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Small for Adult Use
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is so small no matter how I hold it parts of my body are still getting rained on. I'm 6 feet tall, and average build (read no beer belly, and no super broad shoulders). I wouldn't recommend this even as a travel umbrella because it simply doesn't keep you dry. I do recommend this as a children's umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

customer_reviews.title: UTTER PIECE OF  JUNK
customer_reviews.text: You can buy a better umbrella for $ 5 n the street corner of any big city than this umbrella which is badly made low quality which does not open or close automatically- The best part about this useless excuse for an umbrella is that if you bought it from Amazon Prime......you can return it for a refund & buy yourself a quality functional umbrella
customer_reviews.author: Daddyo

customer_reviews.title: Mini umbrella that is hard to close
customer_reviews.text: This is a miniature umbrella that is very hard to close. The handle is very short and the diameter too small to keep rain away. The auto-open works fine but it is a real struggle to close. The only pro is that it is small enough to fit in a purse or the cubby of your car. However, I have had equally small umbrellas that opened up to full size, so I can't even recommend it based on its small form factor. Two thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Mariel

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality...Defective
customer_reviews.text: Very, very disappointed. I carried this very nice looking compact umbrella in my briefcase for quite a while; only used it less than half a dozen times before it would no longer retract. Not only would it not retract but the upper portion of the umbrella was tilted up which means less area to actually protect from the rain...I had to stuff it in a trash receptacle since I couldn't close it! $22+ is far too much to pay for 5 or 6 uses. :(
customer_reviews.author: Robert Armentrout

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella flipped inside out!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed because I thought that this umbrella could withstand strong winds. I live in Houston- not the windiest city in the US, and the umbrella has turned inside out a total of 3 times so far! That is beyond ridiculous. I'm currently looking for a new umbrella...
customer_reviews.author: DivaRia03

customer_reviews.title: Bought two--both duds
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the great reviews--I must have gotten some other product or you all keep your umbrellas on the shelf to just look at. The first one would only close if I held it against a wall and pushed with all my might. The second one never opened with an "easy touch" and when I finally got it opened NO ONE, including brawny guys, could get it closed. I left both in the trash when it stopped raining. I've never been so disappointed (or surprised).
customer_reviews.author: Critical Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nope nope nope
customer_reviews.text: I moved to San Francisco and needed an umbrella since it rained there 60% of the time. The second time I used this umbrella it was in medium rainfall with heavy winds. Within a few minutes of stepping outside the house the wind overturned my umbrella and it was a struggle to fix it while I was walking in the rain. Once that was done, I decided to put the umbrella in my backpack and use my hood instead, which frankly was so much better. I wouldn’t recommend this umbrella as it can not withstand heavy winds.
customer_reviews.author: BillyP

customer_reviews.title: Useless in any wind
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely write reviews, but I felt this deserved one. The first time I used this umbrella, it flipped inside out within thirty seconds of opening it, rendering it useless for its intended purpose. I was drenched, and very unhappy. Will be returning (another thing I very rarely do).
customer_reviews.author: Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than looks, photo in description misleading....
customer_reviews.text: Really short handle. I am petite, so if I think the handle is short, it is REALLY short. The easy open easy close mechanism on handle works ok, seemed to get easier each time I tried it (7) The canopy is not Particularly large. Inner spokes look weak, especially with having the spring loaded tension on them. Short and lightweight when closed, so truly a travel umbrella as stated. Poured water on it to see if the water repellent claim was true, and it poured right back off! That was impressive. Still, really small... almost kid size umbrella. I could keep it in the car for unpredicted rain, but may return it and keep looking... Le sigh.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but annoying
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: They immediately emailed me apologizing for the umbrella not meeting my full expectations. They offered a full refund or a replacement. I declined both options because the umbrella wasn't broken and a replacement would have the same issue. They issued a refund anyway with their apologies Needless to say, this company truly stands behind their products. If only all companies were like this one. Nice but annoying. I like the automatic open/close feature but it's a pain when you only want to close it temporarily. It won't stay up unless you completely compress it to its original position which is a little difficult if you're carrying other things.
customer_reviews.author: JZ1

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as pictured, but wish I'd stuck with London Fog.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the opportunity to test it in the strong New Mexico winds, but it appears sturdy. However, it does not open and close as easily as other umbrellas I have owned. Used it today and found it hard to close completely. I have to force the handle closed. If you don't, the open button will not work. I can now confirm that I am not won over as it does not open/close quickly, which is rather necessary when you want to open it in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Easily damaged with normal use
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is large, but it's the opposite of sturdy and is extremely easy to damage. It says "windproof" but even light wind is enough to be troublesome with this. My umbrella was damaged by moderate wind (one of the ribs broke). Another rib was damaged when I laid the umbrella down (still open) to dry out. This umbrella feels very cheaply made and you really have to baby it.
customer_reviews.author: kbuck

customer_reviews.title: Broke almost right away
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke almost right away. When pressing the button it won't open all the way and you have to push it up by hand. Then when closing, one arm sticks out and won't bend close. I kept telling myself that something was just caught and once I sat down with it, i could get it working again. When I finally got feed up enough to look at it, I saw a small plastic pin in one of the arms had broken. There is no way for me to fix this. It still works when open (but have to manually open and close it) and it is nice and small/light weight.
customer_reviews.author: curleigh

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Original review: This umbrella is pretty nice when it works. I don't live in a place that gets a lot of rain but when we do I would like an umbrella to work. this one only worked around twice, which is disappointing. When it breaks - it breaks. So once it wont open, there are no manual options. Updated review: After writing the review, I reached out to the company. When they heard what happened they sent me another umbrella at no charge. It seems to be working great. If i have any further issues i will update.
customer_reviews.author: Honest _rian

customer_reviews.title: The Best!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional dog walker in Phoenix AZ. I also have had skin cancer removed twice from my nose. Not fun! So, even though I feel funny walking around the streets of downtown Phx holding an umbrella on a sunny day, I don't really have a choice. Plus, I'm obsessed with preserving my skin at all costs, aging sucks. I've tried many umbrella's that all break within a year of using them. I've been using this one (purchased in two different colors) for a while now and it's withstood some pretty powerful wind, opening and closing it every day, three times a day for almost a year now and it's not failed me yet! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi D.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Umbrella Except For The Rust
customer_reviews.text: Let me start this by saying that I’ve bought two of these umbrellas. The first one worked amazingly but was left at a bar so I turned around the very next day to purchase another one. The umbrella was working great until recently when I noticed that the inside began to rust, resulting in one of the arms breaking! I’m disappointed that the umbrella wasn’t able to last an entire year and even more disappointed that i couldn’t find a way to contact the manufacturer directly. This would be easily 5 stars if it wasn’t for the rust
customer_reviews.author: Ray S.

customer_reviews.title: Fine to use as long as you don't expose it to water
customer_reviews.text: After all of two uses, many of the components have already developed a layer of rust that has stained the fabric. I would have gladly paid a little extra for something rust resistant. It's too bad, since the umbrella otherwise seemed promising in terms of its size and mechanism. Oh well, into the trash it goes. Edit: I've modified my original rating of 1 star to 3, to reflect the positive experience that I've had with the seller, who responded very promptly and has offered me both a refund and replacement umbrella without my even needing to send the original unit back. I'll be giving it another shot. Hopefully it goes better this time.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I had to use this umbrella on the day it arrived. We had serious wind and rain and I was extremely pleased with the way this umbrella performed. I've had DOZENS of umbrellas both cheap and expensive and they all fell apart in a strong wind. So far, this Repel umbrella is living up to its advertisement. I also love that is fits perfectly into my tote bag and is very lightweight. I've given it five stars even though I've only used it three times. I hope the good things continues when the really big wind and rain comes our way in a couple of months. If it falls apart, trust me, I will let everybody know.
customer_reviews.author: Essie Lee Lewis

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good... great travel bumbershoot option!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this right before an international trip to South America, during "wet" season, without having the chance to do more than open/close it at home. Happily, it has thus far proved a good decision; I used it during light rain AND lent it to hat-less friends on days that were sunny, for use as a sunblock, and it performed admirably in all cases. (The real test will be when I first encounter a super-windy downpour, but again... so far, so good. ;))
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Great Umbrella, Great Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: So first of all this is a very well made umbrella. Works well. But on a quite gusty day it turned partially inside out and two ribs slightly bent. Maybe still usable but in my opinion it had not lived up to the claims made. So I contacted customer support. They responded very promptly and said that they would replace it. I contacted them on April 13th and the replacement umbrella was in my hands April 20th! I am not shy about contacting customer support when I have a problem with a product. And I don't think I have every received such a great level of support!
customer_reviews.author: Bob G.

customer_reviews.title: Easily flipped over and broke.
customer_reviews.text: Great umbrella. It feels great and is very portable, but theres some downsides. It is kind of small, so it might not cover your legs. Also, mine broke after a few uses during light rain. It flipped inside out and took no effort which was weird. But overall okay quality.
customer_reviews.author: Edith Cuellar

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, the build quality seemed nice at first, it's certainly not flimsy and it can hold up to strong winds. However, after only using it a few times, the hinges that hold the fabric are starting to rust and I can no longer collapse it without significant effort (it appears the outer metal tube of the handle is getting jammed on the inner one when I push it to lock). If it doesn't collapse all the way, it can't be re-opened, so I'm always worried that it won't close and I'll be left without an umbrella. Considering I've only used it about 6 times, I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great Unbrella
customer_reviews.text: The lifetime warranty is what sold me on this umbrella. There are several other features that I really like about this over other umbrellas. There is a Teflon coating on the canopy part which makes water just run off. Another feature of this is that it makes putting the sleve/cover on easier than other umbrellas. The shaft of the umbrella is a strong hexagon shape instead of the traditional round shafts, the additional strength is great for windy days.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Nice umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in good condition, and I opened and closed it with ease. It looks like it is well made and sturdy. I noticed that the material seemed a little thin from what I am use to, however, if the material is treated properly so it doesn't leak, that should not be a problem. As I live in southern Arizona, I have not had an opportunity to use it yet, but it is monsoon season so I should be able to within the next couple of weeks and I will update this review at that time. It is a nice looking umbrella though, so I do not foresee any issues. Well worth the money and you can't beat the warranty!
customer_reviews.author: 2twistedtwice

customer_reviews.title: NOT "super light" or lightweight. Misleading product description.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight umbrella to replace my stolen Davek Mini. This one looks sturdy, and certainly could last a few heavy rains, but is NOT lightweight at all and not compact compared to all the other umbrellas that I have purchased so far. The handle is heavy, and it is too big for my regular purse. Well, since I live abroad and cannot return it (I would if I could!), I will keep it as a replacement umbrella in my car, but I am upset by such a misleading description. Will not buy again from this seller. EDIT: got a refund for this item.
customer_reviews.author: JulieT

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Within a few days my kids had already broken one of the "ribs." I was still able to continue using the umbrella and then just the other day I noticed a tear in the fabric. At this point, it's time to retire the umbrella. I'm a bit disappointed because my Totes umbrellas last as long as it takes to inevitably lose them but this umbrella started coming apart quickly and didn't stand the test of time. Won't be repurchasing.
customer_reviews.author: NJbookluver

customer_reviews.title: Got 10 Months Out of it at Least
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the arms obviously got stuck together somehow when closing the umbrella recently, and when I opened it today they were stuck together and 1 ripped the other 1 off the umbrella itself and bent it fairly significantly. I think it'll still work for the short term, but I'm in the market for another umbrella it appears. Again, this didn't happen during high wind or anything like that, the product broke simply by closing it and opening it again. Update: Received a very quick response from the seller, and a replacement has already been mailed to me. Seller obviously takes product defects very seriously, and I am pleased with the resolution.
customer_reviews.author: JDB

customer_reviews.title: It's an umbrella that won't open!!
customer_reviews.text: I took this umbrella out of its cover as I was out for a walk. The rain was coming down heavily. I removed the cover and tried to open the umbrella, as directed. Nope. Rain pouring now... I'm out for a walk at lunch (kinda comical, if you aren't the guy standing about 1 mile from your office in pouring rain). I try and try but the umbrella will not stay up. Don't buy this umbrella... It simply doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse W. Bender

customer_reviews.title: Failure after about 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: A rivet popped in one of the ribs after just a small number of opening/closing cycles. This let the spring/wire lose and makes that rib not open fully. That completely defeats the purpose of having an umbrella like this, so I'll have to replace it. At least it's cheap enough that I'm not worried about the expense, but it also means it's not worth trying to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kodai

customer_reviews.title: I had higher expectations
customer_reviews.text: Umbrella is not wind proof i don’t know why it would be advertised? I’ve never written a review on Amazon and purchased over 100 items. I understand the umbrella is at a low price, the umbrella it’s self has a loose handle, it won’t come off but it doesn’t feel nice and tight, it would hold up against heavy rain but the wind turned it inside out, i would remove the advertising that states “wind proof” and replace with “travel sized umbrella” I’m not upset with my purchase seeing it was $20 but i was highly under the impression that it would do better with wind.
customer_reviews.author: VQkeagon

customer_reviews.title: Weight is understated
customer_reviews.text: In one place on the Amazon page, the weight of this umbrella is stated to be 11.2 ounces. It actually weighs a bit over 14 ounces. In another place on the page, the weight is stated accurately. How many places does a shopper have to check to find the correct weight?? I ordered it for the 11.2 ounce (false) weight. So the vendor is getting it back.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than standard size, impractical
customer_reviews.text: I figured it was a standard size umbrella. The inches listed made it seem like it was about average. And it didn't say it was "compact". The umbrella is smaller than what I'm used to. It's shorter than average so I have to hold it closer to me (so my son is definitely getting wet) and the canopy part of the umbrella is also shorter - it's not deep and it doesn't envelop enough- which means I will not be protected from rain that is coming down at an angle even the slightest. I wish I could return this, I regret buying it. It might be strong, at least that's what reviews say, but it's not practical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Open
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this umbrella because of the great reviews and for my trip to NYC. The day it did rain the buttons didn’t work at all the umbrella would not function (I thought I was doing something wrong, I got online and looked up instructions on how to open this dang umbrella but it clearly just was defective) i’m Returning it immediately when I return from my trip (I still have another two days here).
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like this product but after a few light uses the ...
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this product but after a few light uses the button stopped working which is one of the main features that I was hoping would work.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good balance between heft and portability.
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella's opening and closing mechanisms feel sturdy and work with confidence. I've used some of these umbrellas in the past that has not last more than a few years. This umbrella's build quality gives me some cofidence that it will last for a while. When open, the coverage area is big enough that it can cover both me and my backpack from rain with some light wind. They sure struck a good balance between the size of the umbrella and the portability of it. They also have a lifetime warranty so if it breaks, i'll be sure to get the same thing again.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Tan

customer_reviews.title: Handled US City and European abuse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the first umbrella as a trial. It worked out well in San Francisco wind and rain so we purchased a second in advance of a trip to Paris and Venice last spring. It handled some of the most wicked rain I've ever been in. Pouring buckets in Venice. Wind handling was very good with what we were faced with in Paris, not hurricane force mind you, but some pretty stiff gusts. I would recommend this umbrella, it is compact and will fit easily into a day pack, business attache, or messenger bag. It is sturdy but light and has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Aw2m8r

customer_reviews.title: Broke twice
customer_reviews.text: Based on the great reviews, I bought this umbrella in September 2018. After only a few uses in not very severe weather, the umbrella broke loose from one of the spokes. To Repel's credit, they promptly sent me a replacement. But after, again, only a few uses (I use another umbrella for heavy rain), two of the spokes got fouled up in each other. I'm hoping they'll honor their guarantee again. It's lightweight and convenient but, at least in my experience, the durability is poor, worse than may $4 umbrellas I've bought on the street. If it breaks this often, it gets only one star from me.
customer_reviews.author: Highhat

customer_reviews.title: Great compact travel umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: Got a chance to use this on a trip to NYC. It rained a couple of times we were there, and it was coming down decently. The umbrella did its job... and it's nicely water-repellent, so when you go to shake the umbrella off, it only takes a few shakes to get most of the rain off. Using it was pretty slick. Undo the velcro, press the button, and it deploys in less than a second. I haven't used it in high winds so I can't comment on that. Still a pretty good, compact travel umbrella for one person for $20!
customer_reviews.author: Ray B.

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella was just ok. Don’t understand why people like it so much. First off the open/close button is fine, but the close function is stupid because it only retracts the canopy and contributes to unnecessary wear and tear on the open/close mechanism. Second, this umbrella only lasted like 6 months. Sure it may be wind proof due to mechanical problems with the canopy. Save yourself some time and buy a bigger golf umbrella, I’m much more satisfied with it even if it’s not as portable
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Raimondi

customer_reviews.title: NOT Windproof (do not buy)
customer_reviews.text: Good umbrella, a little small. It is definitely NOT windproof. Walking down the street a strong gust came and the umbrella went inside out; exactly what it isn't supposed to do Update: Used this a few more times and the wind has destroyed the umbrella. It no longer works. My old umbrella lasted much longer even after being turned inside out. The supports on the umbrella are all bent and no longer support it.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work Entirely
customer_reviews.text: I've bought repel products before and have been very happy with them. Unfortunately, this one doesn't work. Recently, used on a down pour and the hard drops went through the umbrella. It seems this hadn't been treated for water proof coating on the material or something. Every hard drop had a mist got through and you could feel it on your head. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SAC

customer_reviews.title: Not the best umbrella for long term use
customer_reviews.text: I got this umbrella barely a month ago and after barely 5 uses two of the hinges broke. I'm not sure if I got a defective one but I am certainly not impressed with it's durability. It has a great weight and fits pretty much anywhere you would expect but it's no good if it breaks after a handful of uses. I will update if I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Seiya

customer_reviews.title: did not live up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: This was an expensive umbrella, which I sent to my son because it was supposed to be sturdy. Instead, it only lasted a month before it was not able to extend out. My son is careful with things, so it was the products fault. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: austenut

product_meta.title: Repel Umbrella Windproof Double Vented Travel Umbrella with Teflon Coating (Black)
feature_bullets: AUTOMATIC, COMPACT, AND LIGHTWEIGHT - Auto open close function allows for easy one-handed operation. Measuring just 11.5" long and weighing less than 1lb the folding handheld umbrella is extremely packable in purses, briefcases, backpacks, luggage and more.

WIND-DEFYING, DOUBLE VENTED, 9-RIB CANOPY - Most small or mini umbrellas are made of 6 or 8 aluminum ribs but Repel is fortified with 9 resin-reinforced fiberglass ribs and a vented double canopy that flex slightly to withstand powerful gusts without turning inside out.
SUPERIOR REPELLENCY - Waterproof, weatherproof and instantly dry, the foldable and durable Repel Travel Umbrella defends against the elements like nothing else.

QUALITY WORKMANSHIP - Designed with a three-fold chrome plated black metal shaft, and strong metal frame to allow for greater stability in high winds. The ergonomic, slip-proof, and rubberized grip handle with wrist strap allow for easy carrying. A protective travel sleeve is included. Perfect for men, women, teens and kids.
WORLD RENOWNED AND CRITIQUED - Featured on Good Morning America, Rated by Wire Cutter as the Best Umbrella in 2019.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars16,555 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
